Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Father Richard Beuther, St. Peter and Paul R.C. Church, 71 South 3rd Street, Brooklyn, New York.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Reyna.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Father Richard Beuther, St. Peter's and Paul Roman Catholic Church, 71 South 3rd Street, Brooklyn.

Council Member Reyna moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 1, 2007 be adopted and printed by Council Member Gallagher.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Gallagher moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 1, 2007 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Applications no. C 070080 PPQ, a disposition of city-owned property, C 070081 ZSQ and C 070082 ZSQ, special permits, shall be subject to Council review.  These applications are related to application no. C 070079 ZMQ  that is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Jamaica Courthouse Redevelopment, Queens

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Resolution calling on the Council of the City of New York to declare a symbolic moratorium on the use of the “N” word in New York City.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the President Pro Tempore declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Declare a symbolic moratorium on the use of the “N” word in NYC during the month of February, also known as Black History Month.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Consumer Affairs
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the consumer bill of rights regarding tax preparers.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Consumer bill of rights regarding tax preparers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to regulating and licensing pedicabs.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: In relation to regulating and licensing pedicabs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to require that the practice of bottle service be limited to circumstances where it is performed and monitored by a waiter or waitress and calling upon the New York State Liquor Authority (SLA) to establish such monitored service as part of licensed alcohol-serving establishments’ “best practices.”
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the President Pro Tempore called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the President Pro Tempore declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following Council Member formally voted against this item: Council Member Avella.

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Voice Vote.
Items.MatterName: Require that the practice of bottle service be limited to circumstances where it is performed and monitored by a waiter or waitress.

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Temporary task force to study the feasibility of transferring city-owned wetlands to the jurisdiction of the department of parks and recreation.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Governmental Operations

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the contents of a lobbyist’s statement of registration, and to repeal subdivision (g) of section 3-213 of the administrative code of the city of New York, relating to the mailing of forms by the city clerk.
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted and Re-referred to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Contents of a lobbyist’s statement of registration.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to reintroduce and pass the Uniting American Families Act, which would provide a mechanism under the Immigration and Nationality Act to allow United States citizens and legal permanent residents in binational same-sex relationships to sponsor their foreign-born partners for immigration to the United States in a manner consistent with the legal requirements and rights currently enjoyed by opposite-sex couples.
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Immigration and Laid Over
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Laid Over by Council
Items.MatterName: Congress to pass the Uniting American Families Act (H.R. 3006 - S.1278)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Public Safety

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to independent monitors for clubs with multiple or serious violations of the cabaret licensing law or of the rules promulgated thereunder and the reporting of adjudicated violations.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring independent monitoring for clubs with multiple or serious violations of the cabaret licensing law or of the rules promulgated thereunder.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring certain cabarets and public dance halls to install video surveillance cameras at all entrances and exits.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Relation to requiring certain cabarets and public dance halls to install video surveillance cameras at all entrances and exits.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to expanding the nuisance abatement law to include certain violations related to the creation, production, storage and sale of false identification documents, forged instruments and forgery devices.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Expanding the nuisance abatement law to include certain violations related to the production and sale of false identification.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.61, and Assembly Member Clark, A.26, “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to a fine for parked or unattended semitrailers or trailers on streets of a city with a population of one million or more”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Fines for parked or unattended semi-trailers (S.61, A.26).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.62, and Assembly Member Clark, A.28, “AN ACT to amend the general city law, in relation to vacant lots in certain cities”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Vacant lots in certain cities (S.62, A.28).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Clark, A.32, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to imposing administrative sanctions on registered architects, licensed professional engineers and other persons for misconduct with respect to applications and other accompanying documents submitted to the department of buildings of the city of New York”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Sanctions on architects, licensed engineers (A.32).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Thiele, A.1501, “AN ACT to repeal section 1127 of the New York city charter relating to a condition precedent to employment and providing for the refund of excess payments collected after the repeal of the city earnings tax on nonresidents resulting from the application of this repealed section”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Repeal of section 1127 (A.1501).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Sabini, S.1747, “AN ACT in relation to the control and stabilization of rents and rental agreements in certain retail commercial spaces in cities having a population of more than one million”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Rents and rental agreements in certain retail commercial spaces (S.1747).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.1051, and Assembly Member Lentol, A.2665, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing escrow accounts to protect neighboring landowners and tenants from damage due to construction”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Escrow accounts to protect neighboring land owners and tenants (S.1051, A.2665).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese, S.308, “AN ACT to amend the general business law, in relation to adult commercial establishments in cities with a population of one million or more”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Adult commercial establishments (S.308).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1329, and Assembly Member Lentol, A.2886, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating an eight-member task force to review and approve the destruction or demolition of buildings located within the city”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Eight member task force for destruction and demolition (S.1329, A.2886).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.810, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.1528, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to deputy sheriffs members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Deputy sheriffs members of NYERS (S.810, A.1528).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.1604, and Assembly Member Diaz, A.3209, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the twenty-year retirement program for New York city correction members below the rank of captain”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Twenty year retirement program for corrections' members below the rank of captain (S.1604, A.3209).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.811, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.1527, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, in relation to providing a special accidental death benefit to deputy sheriff members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Special accidental death benefit to deputy sheriff members of NYERS (S.811, A.1527).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Dinowitz, A.1029, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to clearly marking pedestrian crosswalks in any city having a population of one million or more persons”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Clearly marking pedestrian crosswalks with city population of 1 million or more (A.1029).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Dinowitz, A.1006, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to allowing citizens to issue tickets to designated officers and appointed employees of the parking violations bureau”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Citizens issue parking tickets of designated officers and appointed employees of PVB (A.1006).

Items.MatterName: Dedicate Jerome Park Reservoir tract in the bronx as parkland (A.3078).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Kruger, S.2522, and Assembly Member Greene, A.212, “AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the adjudication of traffic infractions arising out of the operation of a bicycle”.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign Assembly bills A.795, and A.797 which may help preserve affordable housing for low and middle income New Yorkers residing in a Mitchell-Lama following an opt-out such as Starrett City, as well as Assembly bill A.352, and calling upon the Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) to impose an additional review period to the sale of Starrett City due to the potential of a large displacement of residents who are receiving Section 8 and other Federal housing assistance.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign Assembly bills A.795, and A.797 which may help preserve affordable housing for low and middle income New Yorkers residing in a Mitchell-Lama following an opt-out such as Starrett City.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass H.R. 3458 and the Federal Communications Commission to formalize strong network neutrality principles in order to ensure that the Internet will continue to foster innovation, increase competition, and spur economic growth as well as making the Internet faster and more affordable for all.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology in Government
Items.MatterName: Congress to codify strong network neutrality principles in order to insure that the Internet will continue to foster innovation, increase competition, and spur economic growth.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Bloomberg Administration to place a moratorium on all subsidized child care center contract reductions and terminations in boroughs where the Administration for Children’s Services has not yet implemented the Community Based Enrollment program.

Items.MatterName: Bloomberg Administration to place a moratorium on all subsidized child care center contract reductions and terminations in boroughs where the Administration for Children’s Services has not yet implemented the Community Based Enrollment program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor and the State Legislature to establish easier public health insurance enrollment and re-enrollment processes and implement an aggressive outreach program, so that the 500,000 uninsured children, 900,000 Medicaid-eligible adults and the one-third of all people on Medicaid who are dropped from the rolls each year are enrolled by the end of 2007.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Governor and the State Legislature to establish easier public health insurance enrollment and re-enrollment processes and implement an aggressive outreach program.

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.

Items.MinutesNote: The President Pro Tempore put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately: Int No. 440-A and Int No. 331-A.


See files for individual votes.

At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Quinn) asked for a Moment of Silence in memory of the following individuals:

Marine Cpl. Thomas Saba, 30, of Grymes Hill in Staten Island (CM McMahon's District)
who was killed with six other Marine and Navy personnel when thir helicopter was shot down while trying to rescue casualties in Al Anbar province in Iraq on February 7, 2007.

Ralph Penza, 74, WNBC-TV senior correspondent and back-up anchor, a fixture for over three decades on New York newscasts, died on February 16, 2007 after a long illness.
